snippet: New York’s attorney general is expected to outline legislation to force banks to take responsibility for houses that have been abandoned before banks have finished foreclosing on them.
abstract: New York State Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman is expected to outline legislation that he hopes will force banks to take responsibility for so-called zombie properties, houses that have been abandoned before banks have finished foreclosing on them; New York State has roughly 15,000 zombie homes and leads the nation in the time required to foreclose on a home, at almost three years.
lead_paragraph: New York’s attorney general is expected to outline legislation to force banks to take responsibility for houses that have been abandoned before banks have finished foreclosing on them.

headline.main: A New Effort in Albany to Put Lenders in Charge of Abandoned Properties
headline.print_headline: A New Effort in Albany to Hold Banks Responsible for Abandoned Properties
